text: Julian (Flavius Claudius Julianus, 331 — 26 June 363 sometimes Julian II) was known in Christian tradition as Julian the apostate, or Julian the Philosopher. He was Roman emperor from 360 to 363.Grant, Michael (1980) Greek and Latin authors. 800 B.C. — A.D. 1000 part 1000. H. W. Wilson. Co. p. 240 He is known for having favored Neoplatonic Hellenism over Christianity.A companion of Julian the Apostat. Brill. 20 January 2020 == References == Category:4th-century Roman emperors Category:331 births Category:363 deaths
title: Julian (emperor)
